startFire: Used t' start a fire. Use on campfires, furnaces, etc. t' light them or on an empty tile. Usin' this action may require kindlin', tinder and a fuel item in yer duffle dependin' on th' circumstance.
carve: Used t' carve creature corpses or t' remove objects attached t' th' ground.
setDown: Usin' this item will place it on top o' whatever tile be present in yer facin' direction. This be different than just droppin' th' item.
eat: Consumed on use. May provide benefits t' hunger, thirst, health and stamina; however, may reduce them as well dependin' on th' food.
drinkItem: Consumed on use. Will reduce yer thirst; however, will provide negative effects when drinkin' sea/unpurified water.
rest: Used t' rest fer a period o' time t' regain health and stamina. Ye will belay restin' when reachin' full stamina.
sleep: Used t' sleep fer a period o' time t' regain health and stamina. Duration be based on campin' skill and time o' day. A bonus t' all effects (includin' length) will be granted if facin' a fire or lit object. Hunger and dehydration increase slower while sleepin'.
heal: Consumed on use. Used t' restore a varied amount o' health.
dig: Used t' dn' up resources and items from th' ground.
paddle: Used t' travel over water without gettin' yer feet wet. Yer speed be not reduced in water while paddlin'.
gatherWater: Used t' gather water into th' item.
shoot: Ye can shoot arrows with this item.
cast: Come across a fish in a body o' water and attempt t' cast yer line or net t' catch it.
traverseTheSea: Used t' travel t' new, unexplored lands, leavin' behind yer current surroundings.
sling: Ye can slin' bullets with this item.
repair: Use while facin' a damaged item t' attempt t' repair it. Success based on skill used t' make th' item.
decode: Used fer attemptin' t' read th' map. Use by th' booty location t' reveal how far or close ye be.
learn: Consumed on use. Readin' usually provides useful knowledge.
reinforce: Consumed on use. Use while facin' a damaged item t' attempt t' increase th' overall maximum and minimum durability. Success based on skill used t' make th' item.
gather: Can be used directly t' gather from an adjacent resource tile/object. Gatherin' will attempt t' gather everythin', destroyin' th' plant or mushroom in th' process.
stokeFire: Used on a fire source t' increase th' strength o' th' flame.
pour: Pour on fire t' extinguish th' flames, pour inside a water still t' begin water filtration, pour on a suitable plant t' increase its health, or just simply empty out.
plant: Attempts t' plant th' item on th' tile ye be facin' towards. Some plants may require certain ground types or conditions t' be planted.
gatherTreasure: Attempt t' gather a booty in th' vicinity o' use based on a decoded treasure map. Range o' gather be dependent on yer minin' skill.
ignite: Use this item on a fire source t' start it on fire.
build: Attempt t' construct or assemble th' item on th' tile ye be facin' towards.
openContainer: Usin' this will open it whar ye may drag and drop items t' and from. Weight reduction and decay reduction bonuses may apply t' items inside.
preserve: Used with food items t' extend their life and decay rate.
openBottle: Consumed on use. Usin' this will open it, providin' new and unknown items.
drinkCure: Consumed on use. Used t' cure poisonin' while sometimes providin' other health benefits.
tellTime: Used t' measure th' time o' day or night.
sailToCivilization: After collectin' all th' pieces o' booty, ye can return t' civilization and bask in th' glory o' yer swag and fame. Ye can always return back t' these lands afterwards.
transmogrify: Use while facin' an equippable item t' attempt t' infuse with magical properties.
fire: Usin' a mixture o' black powder alon' with a bullet, ye may fire this weapon.
teleport: With a flick o' th' wand, teleport t' a location in front o' whar ye be facin'.
extinguish: Douse th' torch, extinguishin' th' flame.
drawMap: Draw a map usin' yer skill in cartography o' th' surroundin' area.
pourOnYourself: Liquid be consumed on use. Used t' sooth burn injuries.
squeeze: Consumed on use. Spews a stream o' fire in yer facin' direction.
healOther: Consumed on use. Used t' restore a varied amount o' health t' a creature or human entity.
rubClockwise: Rubbin' this item manifests its effects t' th' holder.
rubCounterclockwise: Rubbin' this item manifests its effects t' th' holder.
grasp: Used t' loot items usin' another item fer safety reasons such as graspin' items in a fire.
till: Use while facin' a tile ye wish t' till, grantin' it properties fer better plant growth.
harvest: Can be used t' harvest an adjacent plant or mushroom without destroyin' th' plant itself, harvestin' just th' produce.
gatherMilk: Attempt t' gather milk from a creature ye be facin'.
read: Open th' book and read th' contents.
smotherFire: Usin' this will extinguish fires as well as cover th' facin' tile with this item.
placeDown: Place th' item down t' th' adjacent tile so it can be used on th' ground instead o' directly from yer duffle.

islandPresence:
"This island seems t' react t' me presence. I often have a weird feelin', like somethin' be watchin' me, but besides th' constant barrage o' bloodthirsty creatures at me heels, that feelin' ne'er leaves me; it follows me even into me dreams. I'm not sure how many more sleepless nights I can lead."

"Thar it be again. I felled a tree. I hear it."

"Thar it be again. I burned a tree. Th' hummin' continues."

"Thar it be again, th' end. I started a forest fire. It's too loud!"

Th' next pages have undecipherable scribbles and diagrams.
treasure:
"Th' greed that has driven us t' these islands now forces us t' stay here. Day after day we search fer th' treasures that brought us t' these lands t' begin with. Our group o' men have discovered several different types o' booty, some even from slayin' th' ravenous indigenous creatures that seem t' roam these islands and caves. But we cannot seem t' leave, we need more. Th' island demands it."

Th' next pages seem t' be ripped out and missin'.

"We have failed. Many have perished. We be missin' th' final piece. I do not think we can make it much further. We seem t' have angered nature itself."
deities:
Th' book has th' inscription, "Deities" on th' spine.

"Th' same three strange symbols seem t' appear again and again on artifacts, cave walls, and even old lon'-ago abandoned buildings. Cross referencin' other resources and even some older journals we have found references t' deities, spirits, and even Gods. Most likely worshiped by th' heathens that used t' inhabit these lands. They seem connected t' these islands somehow."

"Th' three names seem t' be mentioned again and again, Wry, Da, and Aw."
pastCivilizations:
"We have discovered evidence o' many battles here. Not only that, but civilizations, skeletal remains, abandoned houses, and much evidence t' support some type o' apocalyptic scenario."

"Not only that, but it seems t' happen again and again; th' evidence all points t' different ages and different points in time. It appears as though no people be able t' survive and thrive in these lands, like some force be forbiddin' human progress."

"These ravenous, unabatin' creatures be not helpin' matters, that's fer sure."
sandCasting:
Th' entire book seems t' be stained with various chemicals and powders.

"Throughout me metallurgic experiments, I have found th' best way t' forge iron based tools, weapons, and ingots was t' cast large amounts o' material t' shape it. Th' best castin' method I have found usin' resources aroun' me was sand castin'."

"Th' primary ingredient fer creatin' a sand cast be green sand, a mixture o' clay flakes and refined sand. This allows fer th' malleability o' creatin' th' shape o' tool and weapon heads, or even formin' th' ingots in which t' work from."

"Next, we place th' green sand in a flask, crafted with wood, holystone, rock, or raw clay, finishin' th' build o' th' sand cast flask. We then set th' shape, place down some talc powder so th' finished produce can be lifted easier, and pour th' molten smelted mixture into th' cast t' let it set and harden."

Th' book be adorned with crude drawings o' each process.

"I have also found I can use limestone powder as th' flux t' refine ores and remove impurities in th' smeltin' process. Some carbon powder be also required t' get a proper hardness t' th' finished metal."

Th' bottom o' th' paged be signed with "James Townsend, th' Smithy".
wanderingMerchants:
Throughout me exploration o' th' island, I have run across other people, much t' me surprise. It appears as they were in a similar state as myself; somehow trapped in these lands, strugglin' fer our lives. In th' many cases, these folks were not hostile, and we smartly made friendships.

We traded goods and spoke on our situation. One o' th' folks drove a very hard bargain fer some limestone that I needed. If I was a different type o' person, given our secluded settin', I may have simply just taken it through "other means".

Although it was always me intent t' return t' them fer tradin', try as I might, I could no longer locate them. Either they moved on t' other areas or died. Given th' circumstances o' these harsh lands, I’m guessin' th' latter be true.
trappersJournal:
Usin' techniques and skills me father taught t' me in me youth, I was successfully able t' ward off th' monstrosities usin' traps. Th' snare and th' deadfall become me most useful weapons.

I spent days craftin' traps and placin' them outside me shelter instead o' focusin' on traditional weaponry. My combat skills be not so great, and I have not found a meaningful resource t' craft armor, so trappin' appeared t' be me best bet t' dispatch these creatures.

I think I just heard me deadfall squish another giant spider. I'll write more on me improvised spider meat meal. Sadly, cookin' be not me forte either.

slime: A bouncin' globule o' animated gelatin. It be not aware o' yer stirrin'.
jellyCube: An animated cube o' gelatin. Its body jiggles to-and-fro as it moves towards ye with hostile intent.
giantSpider: A gangly, frightful arachnid with th' ability t' poison ye.
bear: A hulkin' carnivorous mammal attracted t' yer scent. A deadly foe without protection.
rabbit: A fast movin', peaceful herbivorous mammal. Useful fer a good meal or as a pet.
snake: A slitherin', poisonous reptile. Appears ambivalent t' yer encroachment.
giantRat: A rat o' unusual size with sharp claws and piercin' teeth. Keep at a distance without equipment.
rat: A small and scurryin' rodent. Afraid o' predators, it will try t' escape yer grasp.

greyWolf: A tall canid animal. Able t' tear into flesh with vicious abandon.
imp: An odd hoverin' creature with thick wrinkled skin and sharp claws.
bogling: A foul, sulphurous-smellin' writhin' mass o' vegetation, seemingly animated and alive.
livingRock: A massive pile o' rocks and minerals that appears t' be alive, or semi-aware at least.
shark: A large blood-thirsty cartilaginous sea creature. Its fin juts from th' waters, tauntin' ye.
zombie: A slow, but stron' foul-smellin' undead or diseased human. Appears t' dislike th' sun.
skeleton: An animated pile o' human, or human-like bones.
pirateGhost: A glowin', ethereal visage o' a pirate. It appears t' be able t' manifest a physical weapon t' attack ye.
timeSkitter: An unusual spider-like creature that appears t' be able t' move through solid objects and move at incredible speeds.
chicken: A flightless fowl that seems fearful o' yer presence. Produces feathers, cackle fruit, meat, and more.
trapdoorSpider: A large spider that appeared from an underground dwellin' as ye stumbled over it.
fireElemental: A creature that be seemingly composed o' only fire. Appears t' spread fire and destruction in its wake.
cod: A common ocean fish, known fer it's nutritionally-dense, flaky white flesh.
hobgoblin: An odd-lookin' humanoid. Dislikes yer presence and appears t' know how t' use traps.
livingMushroom: A livin' mycological abomination. It appears t' have a vengeful attitude towards ye.
kraken: A wiry mass o' thick tentacles, this lumberin' sea-giant be angered by yer existence.

acidSpitterDemon: A small, but fierce demonic-lookin' creature with sharp claws. Appears t' spit an acidic fluid.
skeletalMage: A robed, magic-castin' skeletal humanoid. It appears t' hold a wand; flickin' it t' cast its spells.
clawWorm: A wrigglin' creature with a massive claw-mouth, spawned forth from th' ground due t' vibrations caused by yer gatherin'.
drake: A massive flightless lizard-dragon with large scales and th' ability t' breath fire. A fearsome foe.
goat: A hardy ruminant animal that has horns. A frisky, lively creature, but dangerous when provoked, rammin' at its target with much force.
slitherSucker: A wrigglin' foreign-lookin' worm-like creature. Its mouth be wide and be filled with suction modules and razor sharp teeth.
mudskipper: A slippery fish that appears t' come t' land fer feedin'. Its bulgy eyes and a large gapin' mouth make it quite th' sight.

welcome: A short summary o' th' help menu, and links t' more resources on th' game.
Welcome t' th' Early Access version o' Wayward!

Disclaimer: Wayward be currently in beta status and many things will change and improve over time.
	
		This be th' help menu, which ye can use t' learn mechanics o' th' game. If ye can't come across th' information ye're lookin' fer in this menu, ye can also visit th' {link(http://steamcommunity.com/app/379210/discussions/):Steam Discussion forums}.
	
		If ye want t' keep up with Wayward, please visit th' {link(http://www.waywardgame.com):Wayward Website}, {link(http://www.reddit.com/r/Wayward):Subreddit}, or {link(https://discord.gg/wayward):Discord}.
	
		Want t' help Wayward? Spread th' word, or follow us on one o' th' followin' sites: {link(https://www.facebook.com/waywardgame):Facebook}, {link(https://twitter.com/Wayward_Game):Twitter}, or {link(http://www.indiedb.com/games/wayward):IndieDB}.
controls: A guide on usin' th' keybindings associated with common actions in th' game, t' speed up gameplay, and other related tips and tricks.
Learn common keybinds fer th' game.
interface: How t' interact with and customize th' windows/dialogs.

Wayward uses dialogs, or windows, fer displayin' most in-game information. This means th' interface be almost completely customizable.
	
		Ye can move th' dialogs by draggin' them by th' title bar, and ye can resize them by draggin' on their edges or corners.
	
		Th' "static" elements on th' screen, namely, yer stats, th' menu bar, and th' list o' messages, can all be moved t' other corners or edges o' th' screen, usin' th' options in their context menus ({Bindable.MenuContextMenu}). Th' list o' messages can be put into a dialog with {Bindable.DialogMessages} or usin' th' "Show as Dialog" option in its context menu.
	
		Th' interface setup fer each world be retained between savin' and loadin' th' game.
inventoryManagement: Learn ways o' organizin', movin', and droppin' items.

Thar be many ways t' organize and move items in Wayward.
	
		1.  _Drag and Drop_ : By holdin' {Bindable.GameItemMove}, ye may drag and drop items into a container window, quickslot, equipment slot, or directly on t' th' ground. Draggin' and droppin' t' th' game screen will drop it in front o' ye, or inside a chest if ye be facin' one.
		
		2.  _Quickmovin'_ : With {Bindable.GameItemQuickMove} ye can move an item instantly from yer duffle t' a container or vice-versa. Ye can use this while th' container be not open, if yer character be facin' towards it. Ye may also use {Bindable.GameItemQuickMoveAll} t' instantly move all items o' th' same type.
		
		3.  _From th' item's menu_ : Ye can use {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):actions} t' drop and move items as well: namely, "Drop", "Drop All", "Move", and "Move All". Th' "Move" actions will only appear if thar be a container window open. If th' item in question be o' a high quality, thar will be actions fer droppin' or movin' all items o' that quality.
		
		4.  _Droppin' items_ : By pressin' {Bindable.GameItemDrop}, ye may drop an item onto th' ground. If th' tile in front o' ye be blocked, nothin' will happen, or th' item will be dropped at yer feet, if yer "Drop Location" option be set t' "Drop at Feet When Blocked". Ye may also press {Bindable.GameItemDropAll} t' drop all items o' th' same type.
quickslots: Learn th' easier way t' use actions on items.
Th' easier way t' use actions on items.
fastPickup: A summary on ways t' loot items on th' ground.
A quick way t' get items on th' ground.

If thar be an item on a tile that ye would like t' loot, ye can either walk onto th' tile (if th' {link(Menu.Options.3):"Auto Loot" option} be enabled) or use th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):"Loot Item" action} while facin' th' tile. 
		
		Thar can be multiple items on a tile. When ye be standin' over them, ye can press {Bindable.GameIdle} t' pass th' turn and gather th' items one at a time. Alternatively, ye can loot all th' items on th' tile by facin' th' tile, then usin' th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):"Loot All Items" action}.
actions: A guide on how t' interact with items, tiles, or th' things on a tile.

Openin' up th' actions menu ({Bindable.GameActions}) will brin' up a list o' actions ye can perform, usually on th' tile or object ye're facin'. Some examples include collectin' fruits from plants, pickin' up {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Doodads):doodads} ye've placed, and restin'. Thar be also th' "Jump" action that can help ye get out o' tight spots, but be careful when usin' it as it reduces stamina based on th' weight ye're carryin'.
		
		All items also have actions that can be performed on them. Th' item actions menu be opened by pressin' {Bindable.GameItemMenu}. Tools will usually have actions that can be used on th' facin' tile, while other items will have actions that affect th' tile ye're standin' on, or just ye, such as consumin' a food with th' "Eat" action.
		
		Since findin' an item in yer duffle and usin' th' item action menu on it can be a pain, ye can use {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Quickslots):Quickslots} t' speed up th' process.
stats: Learn how t' understand and manage yer health, stamina, hunger, and thirst.
A numerical representation o' yer wellbein'.

Ye have four core stats: {#--stat-color-health:Health}, {#--stat-color-stamina:Stamina}, {#--stat-color-hunger:Hunger}, and {#--stat-color-thirst:Thirst}.
		
		{heading:Decayin' Stats}
		
		If yer {#--stat-color-stamina:stamina} be 0 and ye take an action, ye will lose {#--stat-color-health:health}.
		
		When yer {#--stat-color-hunger:hunger} or {#--stat-color-thirst:thirst} tick below zero, each subsequent time they go down, yer health will be reduced by their current amount. Fer example, if ye have -4 {#--stat-color-hunger:hunger}, and it goes down t' -5, ye will lose 5 {#--stat-color-health:health}.
		
		When yer {#--stat-color-health:health} reaches 0, ye will die.
		
		{heading:Replenishin' Stats}
		 
		{#--stat-color-stamina:Stamina} replenishes slowly over time, but can also be replenished by restin' or sleepin'.
		 
		{#--stat-color-hunger:Hunger} and {#--stat-color-thirst:Thirst} can be replenished by foods and fresh water.
		 
		{#--stat-color-health:Health} recovers slowly over time, but can be restored with bandages and other health items.
doodads: Learn about, and how t' interact with, objects placed in th' world, such as plants or structures.
A guide on plants, structures, and other objects affixed t' th' ground.

Objects attached t' th' ground like plants, piles o' rocks, furnaces, and even campfires be considered t' be a "doodad". 
		
		T' "collect" them (pick them up), ye can do one o' th' followin':
	
		1. While facin' th' doodad, use th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):"Collect Object With Hands" action}.
		2. Use an item with a "Diggin'" use, such as a stone shovel.
		3. Use an item with a "Carvin'" use, such as a sharp rock.
		4. Use an item with a "Gather" use, such as a wooden pole.
		5. Use an item with a "Harvest" use, such as a stone knife.
		
		Usin' yer bare hands (the first o' th' above options) can sometimes harm ye. Th' other options be safe, as they use tools, but they will decrease th' durability o' that tool.
resourceGathering: A guide on collectin' items from th' environment or creatures.

T' gather resources from trees or rocks, ye must use th' "Gather" action from an item's menu. It be also recommended ye quickslot it fer quick usage. Ye may have t' default its usage as "Gather" if it be not th' default action. See {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Quickslots):Quickslots} fer more information on this functionality. Ye may not always succeed in gatherin' materials (the chances be based on yer skill and tool).
	
		Alternatively, if ye have th' "Auto Gather/Harvest" option set, ye can simply move into resource tiles that block movement t' gather. Ye will use whatever be in yer hands t' gather. Ye can choose what tool specifically be used in either yer port or starboard hand by selectin' which t' use at th' bottom o' yer equipment menu. It be harmful t' try t' resource gather without tools.
	
		Some resources be not gathered in this fashion. Things like small plants and other objects attached t' th' ground (referred t' as doodads) require different methods. Review th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Doodads):"Doodads" help entry} fer more information on these items.
		
		{heading:Resource Stages}
		
		Many plant-based resources have cycles o' growth, followin' a predictable pattern from "germinatin'" all th' way up t' "ripenin'". Every plant and fungus features unique resources at each stage o' growth. If ye attempt t' gather or harvest from a plant too early, ye may not get th' full amount o' resources. Knowin' th' steps o' growth be also important when {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Gardenin'):gardening}.
		
		{heading:Gatherin' & Harvesting}
		
		Gatherin' be a destructive process, meanin', ye will attempt t' gather everythin' from th' plant. Some vegetables and fruits require this t' get th' edible portion, such as potatoes or carrots fer example.

		Harvestin' a plant will only attempt t' get what will keep th' plant alive and/or sustainable. This be not always an option fer all plants, and sometimes will only result in gettin' their seeds.
milestones: A short guide on Wayward's achievement system.
Th' achievement system o' th' game.

Milestones be a list o' goals or achievements ye can work towards. Milestone progress be retained between characters and saves. Completin' a milestone unlocks higher startin' skills, stat points, and even more items.
		
		Most milestones add up over time, such as "Friendly", which counts how many creatures ye tame, or "Chef", which counts how many times ye cook food. However, thar be a few milestones that simply require an amount o' somethin' t' be unlocked. Examples o' this milestone type be "Malevolent" and "Benevolent", which require yer malignity or benignity t' be at 64000.
heldItems: Usin' th' port and starboard hand equipment slots.
Understandin' th' use o' both o' yer hands.

Yer port and starboard hand equipment slots be interchangeable. Ye can equip two weapons, two tools, two shields or some godforsaken combination in between. 
		
		Ye will notice th' options "Port Hand" and "Starboard Hand" in th' equipment dialog ({Bindable.DialogEquipment}). With both options enabled, ye will use both hands (and whatever be equipped in each slot) in combat and in gatherin'/harvestin' (with "Auto Gather/Harvest" enabled). Only one hand be used per turn, so both bein' enabled means th' hands switch off. Be careful t' disable a hand if ye don't have somethin' equipped in it, as ye could harm a hand by mistake. 
		
		If both hands be disabled, automatic gatherin' and combat be not possible.
	
		T' receive a parryin' defense bonus, ye must be holdin' an item in each hand (one t' parry with, one t' fight with).
crafting: A guide t' th' craftin' system: What items t' use, and affectin' th' output durability and quality.
Th' ins and outs o' smashin' materials together.

Ye can open th' craftin' dialog with th' "Craftin'" menu bar button, or with {Bindable.DialogCrafting}.
		
		Craftin' be simple t' perform, but th' system has a lot o' depth.
		
		 _Which Items Be Used_ 

		When hoverin' over a recipe (item) in th' craftin' window, th' items that will be used t' craft it will be highlighted with a white border. 
		
		Ye may notice that th' recipe always uses th' first instance o' th' item in yer duffle. T' change what items be used in a craft, ye can simply change th' order o' th' items in yer duffle.
		
		 _Durability and Quality_ 
		
		Th' durability and quality o' craftin' ingredients affects th' durability and quality o' th' resultin' item: 
		- Ingredients that be damaged will cause th' resultin' item t' be less durable. 
		- Usin' remarkable, exceptional or legendary items increases yer chances t' craft a high-quality item. 
		- Decayable items (such as food) also gain decay bonuses from usin' higher quality items in th' craft.
		
		 _Unlockin' New Recipes_ 
		
		Ye can come across new craftin' recipes by gatherin' th' required items in yer duffle and by findin' old instructional scrolls.
death: It will happen t' us all eventually. This contains information about what carries over between lives.

Death be permanent. Although ye may have died, all o' th' craftin' recipes ye have discovered will be ready on yer next playthrough. Yer {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Milestones):Milestones} will also carry over, providin' ye multiple startin' benefits.
creatureTaming: A small guide on how t' tame creatures usin' a variety o' methods.
Learn about all th' options fer tamin' creatures.

There's a variety o' methods fer attemptin' t' tame creatures in Wayward. These include:
		
		1. Usin' th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions): "Tame" action in th' action menu} when facin' a 
		creature. Th' chances o' success o' this method be quite low, especially at lower skill levels and varies dependin' on what th' creature be and their difficulty.
		2. Usin' th' "Offer" option on an item when facin' a creature. If th' creature wants th' item, it will accept ye as its owner.
		3. Droppin' items on th' ground and havin' creatures move over it will have them become tame towards ye (or some godforsaken player that be closest t' th' creature) if they accept th' item.
		
		Aberrant creatures be harder t' tame and will sometimes reject ye as its owner even when offerin' items. This chance be based on yer animal tamin' skill.
gardening: Learn about th' cycles o' growth fer plant-life and tips on gardenin'.
Tips on gardenin' and information on growth cycles.

Th' full plant life cycle be represented within Wayward. In order, these be: germinatin', seedlin', vegetative, buddin', flowerin', ripenin', and dead. Fungus follows th' same steps, but be named: germinatin', spreadin', formin', yen', fruitin', and full. Each o' these stages provide different {link(Menu.HelpArticle.ResourceGatherin'):resources when gatherin' or harvesting}.
		
		Ye can attempt t' water plants (by usin' th' "Pour" action on water containers) or plant them on fertile soil t' reduce their growth time and increase their fertility fer spreadin' when mature enough t' spread.
overweight: Learn th' impacts o' bein' overweight.

If ye be carryin' too much weight, ye will be "Encumbered". Th' first level o' encumbrance will slow down yer movement and reduce {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Stats):stamina regeneration}. If it progresses t' th' second level, "Overburdened", ye will take damage as ye move. 
	
		Ye can drop items from yer duffle with {Bindable.GameItemDrop}, {Bindable.GameItemDropAll} (to drop all o' one type o' item), ye can use th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):"Drop" action on th' item}, or ye can drag and drop them on t' th' game screen.
merchants: Learn how t' trade and interact with wanderin' merchants.

Ye can drag items into th' wanderin' merchant's duffle t' receive barter credit. Alternatively, ye can also use th' item's menu t' trade as well. Ye can use this barter credit t' trade fer other items that ye wish t' receive in return. Ye can come back at some godforsaken time t' trade with th' merchant, but be careful, they may "wander" away fer good eventually.
		
		Yer barterin' skill influences th' amount o' barter credit received when tradin' items; however, merchants will always trade items back at a higher value.
		
		If ye do not wish t' trade with th' merchant, ye can also choose t' instigate an attack towards th' wanderer usin' th' {link(Menu.HelpArticle.Actions):"Attack" option in th' action menu}. But, be careful; they won't take kindly t' such hostile actions.
multiplayer: Information on th' multiplayer system in Wayward.

Multiplayer in Wayward be enabled fer up t' 32 players. Multiplayer works on a simulated real-time mode whar each turn happens on a fixed interval. "Casual" and "Hardcore" modes work a bit differently than in single player. Casual mode allows players t' respawn as per normal, but in hardcore mode, when ye die ye will continue t' play in dredgie form, allowin' ye t' spectate but not interact normally. Multiplayer also allows fer a special PVP flag t' be set t' allow players t' hurt and kill other players. Multiplayer options can be set in th' multiplayer menu via th' pause menu accessed with {Bindable.GamePause}.
	
		Creature spawn rates, creature difficulty, and reputation be all based on how many connected players thar be and will scale and average based on each individual player.
		
		{heading:Commands}
		Ye can use several special commands while playin' multiplayer. T' see a list o' all possible commands, type "/commands" in th' chat bar and hit enter. Th' followin' commands be also available fer use:
	
		{#--text-color-faded:/players} — Shows a list o' all connected players.
		{#--text-color-faded:/ping} — Shows yer latency t' th' host player.
		{#--text-color-faded:/kick} — Allows th' host t' kick a player.
		{#--text-color-faded:/banned} — Shows a list o' all banned players.
		{#--text-color-faded:/ban} — Allows th' host t' ban a player.
		{#--text-color-faded:/unban} — Allows th' host t' unban a player.
bugs: Did ye get an error? Please report it!
Learn how t' report bugs and debug Wayward.

Please report all th' issues ye spot! While we try t' ensure Wayward be very stable, some things fall through th' cracks. Wayward be still in beta status and our development team be very small. Therefore, without players reportin' issues, they may stay unresolved. If ye do report yer bugs, we cannot express just how much we appreciate them! 
		
		With that bein' said, {link(https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=798938225):here be a guide on how t' report and debug issues ye have with Wayward}.
		
		Report bugs and issues at:
		1. {link(http://steamcommunity.com/app/379210/discussions/1/):Steam Discussions Bug Reports forum} OR
		2. {link(https://discord.gg/wayward):Discord}

bleeding: {0?{0}:Usin' me bare hands t' {1}} has caused me t' begin bleedin'. If I do not cease th' flow o' blood, me situation will smartly become much grimmer. I must stem th' flow o' blood usin' a bandage, tourniquet, or suture. I'm startin' t' feel a bit faint…
burned: My seared flesh remains as painful as th' moment I burned it. I know that while I am in this constant and unabatin' pain, me focus and wellbein' will be hampered. It may be wise t' attempt t' soothe this pain. Perhaps with pourin' liquid over th' burn, I can stifle th' agony. It may be an even wiser idea t' take a swim and use th' minerals within th' water t' both sooth and heal th' afflicted wound.
caving:
When outside, I hear th' chirps and calls o' birds and small animals, and I hear th' stron' winds from th' ocean rustle th' leaves o' trees and other fauna. Every once in a while, in th' distance, I hear a loud growl or th' sounds o' a fevered chase through th' underbrush, o' a predator and its prey. 
	
	Down here, however, be different story. It be eerily quiet in th' briny depths o' th' island. And unlike above, th' infrequent sounds that I /do/ hear send shivers down me spine. A faint tip, tap, as water drips in th' distance, a thin whistle as air passes through cracks in th' rough stone. An intermittent clickin' noise, o' what I can only imagine must be th' claws o' a large arthropod.
	
	It would be surprisin' if these caves didn't have /somethin'/ within them. Thar be other signs o' human activity on this island, th' caves should be no different. Maybe booty or other swag. However, I would be lyin' t' myself if I said I wasn't horrified at th' thought o' continuin' deeper.
combat:
As I engage in combat with {0}, I acknowledge it may not be th' best course o' actions, given me current situation. Th' concept o' "fight or flight" remains lingerin' in me mind. Perhaps runnin' from {0} could be a consideration in th' future. Attemptin' t' tame or offer food t' th' creature has also crossed me mind.
	
	If all else fails, I must protect me life through mortal conflict and dispatch o' th' creature. I will endeavor t' record me findings on th' effectiveness o' me weapons against certain types o' creatures. I note fer example, that {0} be seemingly resistant t' {1} damage types, and vulnerable t' {2} damage types. This also applies t' th' potential damage th' creature inflicts on me against me own armor.
	
	In a previous situation, parryin' proved t' be very valuable, allowin' me t' block incomin' attacks from me sparrin' partner. As lon' as I hold two weapons or a shield in me off-hand, I should be able t' mitigate some damage from me opponent.
corpse: {0} lays thar, lifeless. In order t' maintain me own life, perhaps it would be beneficial t' use a sharp tool or material t' carve this corpse and gather th' usable remains.
creatureTaming:
I recall a more innocent time in me life as I witness th' deceased {0}. Th' adage, "violence be not th' answer" floods me mind as I ponder practicin' benevolence against th' creatures here.
	
	I could attempt t' tame creatures usin' me skills; however, perhaps an even better idea would be t' offer th' creature food it would like t' consume. Both options involve gettin' close t' th' creature. Perhaps I can simply leave th' items on th' ground and see if they will act in kindness towards me after acceptin' me offerin' as they move towards it. I know I will become more successful with any o' these options as me skills grow.
dehydration:
Th' rhyme echoes in me head, "water, water, everywhere, nor any drop t' drink". My mind runs cloudy; me mouth bone-dry. I'll require water if I am t' last any longer.
	
	Unfortunately, th' largest body o' water in me vision be nearly undrinkable in its natural form. I'll need t' construct a water still if I am t' convert th' salinated sea water t' potable water. It be quite th' endeavor indeed.
	
	If I am lucky, I may be able t' come across fresh water sources inland or in th' caves below. It should be drinkable in its natural form, but errin' on th' side o' caution, it may be prudent t' boil it fer safety.
durability:
My {item} be close t' breakin' from use. {canRepair?Usin' me {repairItemName}, I should be able t' repair it easily enough:With th' right resources, I should be able t' fashion myself a hammer t' repair it}.
	
	If I actively search out high quality materials t' craft me tools, armor, and weapons with, I can expect much higher durability on them, especially after me skills have improved. {canGlue?I can also craft glue to:If I ever manage t' come across out how t' concoct a glue, I can} further reinforce me items, providin' much higher durability.
encumbered:
This confounded burden! My pack be overflowin' with heavy items that I will need t' purge in order t' decrease me encumbrance. Carryin' this many items will slow down me movement and heavily impact me stamina.
	
	Some o' th' heaviest things in me duffle include {0}, {1}, and {2}.
failureInCrafting:
I failed in me attempt t' craft {0}, mostly due t' me lack o' skill and knowledge in {1}. I think with repeated attempts, I'll gain some knowledge t' hopefully succeed in craftin' {0} eventually. I also hope that th' materials can suffer th' wear that me poor craftin' skills be placin' on them. I may even need t' replace some components that I am damagin' on each attempt.
	
	Although I have many ideas on what t' craft with th' items in me duffle, some o' them may be quite difficult t' craft without first havin' an intermediate, advanced or even expert skill level in th' craft fer each item.
gardening:
As I work on {0}, I reflect on th' growth stages o' vegetation that I have witnessed. Most plants seem t' begin producin' th' most valuable resources at aroun' th' flowerin' stage, but I have observed th' most bountiful haul comes durin' th' ripenin' stage, when th' fruits and vegetables be ripe fer th' takin' and th' seeds be available t' gather.
	
	If I want t' succeed at gardenin', I may also need t' consider tryin' me hand at craftin' fertilizer and fertile soil fer me garden. I mustn't also forget t' water me plants. Waterin' them will surely help them grow and survive lon' enough t' produce th' resources which seem all too dire in me situation.
healthIssues:
My wellbein' be at an all-time low. I'm bruised, battered, and nearly defeated. My only chance at a respite be through medical intervention, rest, healthy foods, or ideally, all three.
	
	{clothin'?As much as it pains me t' consider it, disassemblin' me clothin' t' craft makeshift bandages appears t' be a good option in me current predicament.}{healin'?Luckily, I do have some items t' be used fer healin' within me duffle includin' {healingItemName}.}
inedible: Consumin' {item} may not have been th' best o' ideas. I {poisoned?think I may:am probably lucky not to} have been poisoned by it... It would be prudent t' pay better attention t' what I ingest. Somethin' like that should only be consumed when I am in dire straits.
merchantile:
I meet {0} today, a person in a similar state as myself; survivin' on this island and livin' off th' land. They seemed friendly enough and offered t' trade items they had found with me.
	
	My skill in barterin' may pay off when decidin' on a trade value, which we have signified with a credit system. {0} gives me credit when I give items t' them, and reversely, removes credits when I come across an item in their duffle worth takin' fer myself.
	
	Even though I found this valuable tradin' partner, th' thought o' somethin' more nefarious has crossed me mind. Takin' their supply by force would likely put me at odds with th' island, but it may be worth it fer their belongings and equipment.
nightfall: Dusk be smartly approachin'. Who could know what creatures lurk in th' darkness — it would be wise t' seek shelter or make a camp fer th' night.
poisoned: My vision blurs as I write this; me stomach tied in knots. {0} has caused me t' become poisoned. I can feel myself gettin' weaker even through th' process o' writin' this note. Thirst and hunger consumes me, and me wellbein' be in jeopardy. I must attempt t' fabricate a cure. Perhaps plants o' a medicinal nature may aid me in this bodily turmoil.
reputation:
It seems that as time passes and th' struggle fer survival continues, th' actions I take which be averse t' th' benefit o' th' island come back t' haunt me.
	
	When I sow plants, or respect th' island's inhabitants, less o' them seem t' be hostile. Likewise, when I gather resources, deface th' landscape, or attack creatures, I see malicious beasts much more frequently.
	
	As o' writin' this, it seems as though th' island be {0?{#--message-type-good:benign}:{#--message-type-bad:malign}}. Fer th' benefit o' me survival, I may want t' limit th' scope o' me damage t' th' natural environment.
staminaReplenishment: My breath be fast and heavy. I'm nearly worked t' th' point o' exhaustion. I should proceed t' slow me work t' a bare minimum while me stamina replenishes itself. More efficiently, I could try restin' on th' ground, or even sleep in a bedroll fer maximum benefits. Rest be important fer me sanity and me survival.
stranded:
I awake t' find myself no longer in th' company o' hearties or a fine seafarin' vessel. Instead I discover myself in tattered clothin', with but a few possessions: {0}, and other shoddy items. 
	
	Treasure... Th' thought be vague and fleetin', but... I remember somethin' about booty.
toolUse:
I'm reminded o' th' proverb, "the right tool fer th' right job" as I attempt t' {0} usin' me bare hands. I know that usin' a tool fer {1} would reduce me change o' injury as well as provide much needed efficiency.
	
	Furthermore, I've observed th' increased efficiency o' usin' a bladed tool while lumberjackin' and usin' a blunt tool while minin'. Th' proverb proves its innate truth.

  • Increases th' amount o' resources gathered/harvested at a time.
camping:
• Increases th' amount o' turns slept when usin' a bedroll.
  • Increases chance o' startin' a fire.
  • Increases th' accuracy o' tellin' th' time with a sundial.
  • Increases th' effectiveness o' extinguishin' open fires with th' smother action.
cartography:
• Increases chance t' successfully read tattered maps.
  • Decreases obscurity when readin' tattered maps.
claythrowing: • Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items usin' clay.
cooking:
• Influences quality and success rate o' cookin' items (via craftin').
  • Influences decay o' cooked items.
fishing:
• Increases chance t' successfully catch a fish. Increases maximum range when usin' a fishin' rod.
  • Increases th' range in which ye can gather underwater booty from.
fletching: • Influences quality and repair rate o' crafted arrows, bows, and slings.
glassblowing: • Influences quality and success rate o' crafted items usin' glass.
leatherworking: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' leather.
lockPicking: • Increases chance t' successfully unlock a chest.
lumberjacking:
• Increases chance o' gatherin' resources on trees.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while lumberjackin'.
  • Increases th' amount o' resources gathered at a time.
mining:
• Increases chance o' gatherin' resources while hittin' rock/holystone or diggin'.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while minin' and diggin'.
  • Increases th' range in which ye can gather booty from.
  • Increases th' amount o' resources gathered at a time.
mycology:
• Increases effectiveness o' eatin' mushroom consumables.
  • Decreases chance o' tramplin' mushrooms when steppin' on them.
  • Increases chance o' gatherin'/harvested resources on mushrooms.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while gatherin'/harvestin' from mushrooms.
  • Decreases spore germination time.
  • Increases th' amount o' resources gathered/harvested at a time.
parrying:
• Increases yer base defense value when holdin' an item in each hand.
  • Increases chance t' take less damage in combat.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction from bein' attacked.
stonecrafting: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' stones and rocks.
swimming:
• Increases speed in water travel.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction in water.
tactics:
• Increases yer base attack value.
  • Increases chance t' hit targets in combat.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while attackin'.
tailoring: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' cloth or fabric.
throwing: • Increases attack damage, accuracy, and maximum range when throwin' or slingin' an item.
tinkering: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' miscellaneous resources and methods.
trapping:
• Increases th' amount o' damage and success rate o' trappin' creatures.
  • Reduces chance o' settin' off traps and reduces damage taken from traps.
woodworking: • Influences quality, repair, and success rate o' crafted items usin' wood.
taming:
• Increases chance o' successfully tamin' a creature.
  • Increases length o' time creature will be tamed fer.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction when tamin'/offerin'/milkin'.
  • Decreases amount o' happiness reduced when milkin' goats.
  • Increases chance o' tamin' when offerin' an aberrant creature items.
gardening:
• Increases chance o' plantin' a plant or mushroom.
  • Increases chance o' successfully tillin'.
  • Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while tillin'.
  • Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items requirin' gardenin' skill.
bartering: • Influences th' amount o' barter credit received when tradin' items.

fire: A dangerous open flame providin' heat and light.
honeyFungus: A parasitic tree fungus that can grow and spread on livin', decayin', and dead plant material.
tumblingTumbleweed: A dry and brittle tumblin' weed, broken off from its roots and spreadin' seeds in its meanderin' path.
